newsitem.title: USA: McDonald's franchisees to launch value plan.
newsitem.headline: McDonald's franchisees to launch value plan.

text.p: McDonald's Corp said Friday its franchisees approved its value meal program that includes lowering the cost of some of its sandwiches to $0.55 when purchased with a soft drink and french fries.
"We intend to attract customers with price and bring them back with the experience," George Kunz, chairman of the fast food chain's Operators National Advertising Board, said in a statement.
McDonald's, which has more than 20,000 units worldwide and more than 12,000 restaurants in the United States, said the value meal program will begin in 55 days.

Earlier this week, a McDonald's franchisees told Reuters the company's value promotion will feature a different sandwich each month selling for $0.55. The Big Mac is expected to be the first sandwich, the franchisee said.
A McDonald's spokeswoman late Friday declined to confirm whether the Big Mac would be the first sandwich, citing competitive concerns.
Industry analysts said earlier this week the move could set off a price war among major fast food businesses, a conflict that could lower profits and harm relations with franchisees.
McDonald's said its interests are aligned with those of its more than 2,700 U.S. franchisees.
"We're pleased that our owner/operators weighed the facts carefully and came to the same conclusion we did," Jack Greenberg, chairman of McDonald's USA.
"This initiative will be good for our customers, our franchisees and our business."
